headline: Varsity researchers suspend strike, FG meets SSANU, NASU
summarized_story:
THE Academic Staff Union of Research Institutions has suspended its strike, which commenced last October over unresolved issues with the Federal Government.
The union disclosed this in a letter to the Minister of Labour and Employment, Chris Ngige, signed by its Secretary-General, Theophilus Ndubuaku.
According to the letter, the suspension of the strike takes immediate effect.
“The Academic Staff Union of Research Institutions hereby writes to inform you of our decision to suspend, with immediate effect, our ongoing strike,” the letter read in part.
The conciliation meeting, which commenced around 2pm on Thursday at the labour ministry, was ongoing as of the time of filing this report.

headline: Campaign in Mecca, desecration of religious sanctuary –NAHCON
summarized_story:
THE National Hajj Commission on Thursday warned politicians against engaging in any political activities, including discussions and rallies that were detrimental to the sanctity of the Holy mosque in Saudi Arabia.
The organisation described the action of some Nigerian politicians displaying posters of their candidates in the grand mosque in Makkah during the Ramadan Umrah (lesser Hajj) as a sacrilege that attracts penalties when apprehended.
“Kindly recall that the Saudi Arabian authorities are very strict on any form of politicking, while in their land especially not in the Holy Kaabah where devotees engage in solemn prayers.
“This action is tantamount to the desecration of a religious sanctuary which attracts penalties when apprehended.
Hence, in the actors’ interest and Nigeria’s image, pilgrims are cautioned to desist from such illegal activities please.”Copyright PUNCH.

headline: Defunct PHCN retirees not entitled to 33 per cent increase in pension – PTAD
summarized_story:
,The Pension Transitional Arrangement Directorate (PTAD), said that workers of the defunct Power Holding Company of Nigeria (PHCN) are not entitled to the pension increase of 33 per cent.
Mr Gbenga Ajayi, PTAD’s Head of Corporate Communications, said in a statement on Thursday in Abuja that the PHCN pensioners were already on a special salary structure before the pension review for pensioners was approved.
Ajayi said that the clarification was necessary as the attention of PTAD Management had been drawn to a growing agitation by some group of PHCN Pensioners, known as concerned PHCN Pensioners.
He said that the group is alleging that PTAD had colluded with some “powerful individuals” to deprive them of the 33 per cent pension increment as approved by the Federal Government in 2010.
“It should be noted that PHCN Pensioners took the Federal Government to the National Industrial Court (NIC) Abuja on this issue.

headline: 2023: Group buys, presents N20m Senatorial nomination form to Adeola in Ogun
summarized_story:
By James Ogunnaike, ABEOKUTAA political group in Ogun West Senatorial District, ‘West to West for DA Movement,’ on Wednesday presented the Expression of Interest and Nomination Forms to Senator Solomon Olamilekan Adeola in support of his Senatorial ambition in 2023.
The Chairman of the group, Dr. Iziaq Salako, in his address, commended Senator Adeola for heeding to the call of leaders in Ogun West Senatorial district to contest for the senatorial seat.
“This is an unprecedented feat signifying a new trajectory of collectivity and brotherhood in Ogun West Senatorial district”.
Responding, Senator Adeola in his emotion-laden voice appreciated the Movement for their love and support of the project.
The lawmaker, who is currently representing Lagos West Senatorial District, said he was “overwhelmed” by the show of support extended to him to pursue his ambition in the state.

headline: Defunct PHCN pensioners storm PTAD office, protest unpaid entitlements
summarized_story:
Pensioners of the defunct Power Holding Company of Nigeria (PHCN) on Thursday staged a protest at the Lagos office of the Pension Transitional Arrangement Directorate (PTAD) over their unpaid entitlements.
The pensioners, under the aegis of Concerned PHCN Pensioners, a pressure group, appealed to President Muhammadu Buhari to intervene in the matter.
They claimed that issues of non-payment of their entitlements had yet to be addressed in spite of repeated calls on PTAD.
The News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) reports that the group had in March 2021 staged a protest at the same office over issues relating to the pensioners’ entitlements.
They also claim that PHCN pensioners have yet to receive the 33 per cent arrears of pension increment approved during President Goodluck Jonathan’s administration, among others.

headline: Oyetola flags off N3.2bn Osogbo township roads
summarized_story:
Shina Abubakar, OsogboOsun State Governor, Adegboyega Oyetola on Thursday, flagged off the reconstruction of roads within Osogbo/Olorunda/Irepodun/Orolu Federal Constituency.
The roads awarded to Messed SlavaBorgu construction company are valued at N3,265,623,449.00 with a completion period of 12 months.

headline: COAS commissions 8 Division RSM Quarters in Sokoto
summarized_story:
By Musa Na Annabi SokotoThe Chief of Army Staff Lt General Faruku Yahaya on Thursday commissioned the newly completed Quarter regimental sergeant major, (RSM) of 8 Division, Sokoto.
The quarters were built to accommodate the RSM of 8 Division and that of Garrison command aimed at providing the two officers with a befitting accommodation.
In his remark the General Officer Command (GOC) Nigerian Army 8 Division, Sokoto Major General Uwem Bassey said the gesture is part of the COAS directive to massive construction of befitting official residences for RSMs in all the Divisions across the country.
On his part, the commandant 48 Engineering brigade Brig General Obot Silas Obot said the contract was handled by Alabins investment supervised by the Nigerian Army engineering corps.
The COAS commissioned other projects at the Garrison after touring the barracks to inspect some facilitiesThe highlight of the event was the presentation of the keys of the houses to the two beneficiaries by the chief of army staff.

headline: Zulum dissolves Borno State Executive Council
summarized_story:
Borno State Governor, Professor Babagana Umara Zulum, has approved the dissolution of the Borno State Executive Council.
The dissolution, which is with immediate effect, was contained in a statement signed by the Permanent Secretary, Administration and General Services, Danjuma Ali on behalf of Secretary to the State Government and made available to journalists by the governor’s spokespersons from the press unit of the Government House in Maiduguri.
The members were directed to handover affairs to permanent secretaries in their ministries.
The statement explained that the dissolution was to create an enabling environment for interested members of the EXCO to legally participate in forthcoming primaries and congresses of the All Progressives Congress, APC.
Zulum, according to the statement, expressed deepest appreciation to members of the executive council for unquantifiable contributions while they held offices and wished them the best of luck in future endeavors.

headline: Stop exposing yourself to life-threatening relationships – Akwa Ibom First Lady begs GBV victims
summarized_story:
Akwa Ibom State First Lady, Martha Emmanuel, has advised women, especially victims of gender-based violence to consider stepping aside from abusive relationships rather than exposing themselves to life-threatening risks.
Speaking during the inauguration of a Sexual and Gender-Based Referral Center for Uyo Senatorial District on Thursday, Emmanuel, who is also the chairperson of the State Gender-Based Violence Management Committee, urged victims to always report abusive cases to law enforcement agents, saying her committee will not spare resources in bringing perpetrators to book.
She said, “Victims of abusive relationships should consider the option of stepping aside than expose themselves to life-threatening risks.
“I encourage all victims of sexual and gender-based assaults in the state to report to the law enforcement agents, our Committee is ever ready to swing into action once notified.”

headline: Akwa Ibom: Gani Adams writes Gov Emmanuel, demands justice for murdered Yorubas
summarized_story:
The Aare Ona Ona Kakanfo of Yoruba land, Iba Gani Adams, has urged Akwa Ibom Governor, Udom Emmanuel to ensure that Yorubas killed in Ibeno Local Government Area get justice.
In a letter to Emmanuel, Adams told him that the perpetrators of the dastardly act must face the full weight of the law.
Titled “Killing of Yoruba and urgent need to ensure justice”, the Aare said security reports indicated that Yoruba people were being targeted.
He said it was strange that Yoruba people, who have been living peacefully and respecting their hosts, were attacked.
The traditional leader commended the Chairman of Ibeno Local Government, Chief Henry Mkpa for the 7pm to 6am curfew.

headline: Man breaks into Soun’s palace, claims throne
summarized_story:
A man broke into the palace of the Soun of Ogbomoso yesterday, violently laying claim to the vacant throne.
He attacked and knocked off the teeth of a palace chief, Sheu Ayinla, during the intrusion.
Chief Ayinla, who narrated the incident told reporters said he was in the palace to ensure that everything was normal when the intruder attacked him.
He said: “ I was in the palace and just called a food vendor when I saw the man ramping up towards the palace court.

headline: Abuja-Kaduna train operation to resume
summarized_story:
Train operations on the Abuja-Kaduna corridor will resume soon, the Nigerian Railway Corporation (NRC) said yesterday.
The Corporation also said that passengers would have to provide their National Identification Number (NIN) to buy train tickets on any of its train service network.
According to the NRC management, the damaged track on the Abuja-Kaduna corridor had been fixed.
The statement reads: “As we have mentioned in our earlier releases, the Abuja – Kaduna Train Service (AKTS) will resume soon with additional security features.

headline: Vice chancellors plan Turkey trip for wives
summarized_story:
In spite of the ongoing strike by university teachers and workers, wives of Vice Chancellors of ivory towers are to embark on a five-day trip to Turkey.
The trip for a Leadership and Management Masterclass, Fellowship Induction programme is scheduled for July 18 to 23, 2022.
According to a May 5 letter by the Committee of Vice Chancellors of Nigerian Universities, the vice-chancellors’ wives are expected to pay a course fee of N1.5m each.
The letter by the committee’s Secretary-General, Yakubu Ochefu is titled ‘Invitation to the Istanbul 5-Day Leadership & Management Masterclass, Fellowship Induction for Spouses of Vice Chancellors, Women in Academics and Higher Education Leadership.’It reads in part: ”We understand the vital role spouses play in supporting Vice Chancellors as they execute their day- to day administration of universities.
It is therefore imperative, that capacity building exercises be put in place for the Women in Academics and spouses of Vice Chancellors in Nigerian universities.

headline: Bishop Sunday Onuoha to chair The Sun awards
summarized_story:
methodist Bishop and co-chair of Inter-faith Dialogue Forum, Bishop Sunday Onuoha, will chair The Sun Awards 2021.
Twenty-six people will receive various awards at The Sun Award ceremony holding tomorrow, May 7, 2022 at the Eko Hotels & Suites, Victoria Island, LagosIn accepting the invitation to be Chairman, Bishop Onuoha said it was gratifying to be part of history of honouring Nigerians who have made marks in their fields of human endeavour.
Bishop Onuoha, who served as Special Assistant on Privatisation in the Presidential Cabinet of President Olusegun Obasanjo in 2003, is founder of Vision Africa International, which empowers Nigerians and other Africans to solve problems and cure society’s ills.
Bishop Onuoha, in 2009, led the Nigerian Inter-Faith Action Association (NIFAA), which is the largest Christian-Muslim collaboration in history.
Meanwhile, popular television host and filmmaker, Frank Edoho, of “Who Wants to be a Millionaire” fame, will be the host of The Sun Awards 2022.

headline: Primaries: INEC insists on June 3
summarized_story:
From Romanus Ugwu, AbujaINEC has told the 18 political parties to adhere to the timeline for the conduct of their primaries for the 2023 general elections, stating that the deadline is firm and fixed.
He said in compliance with section 82(1) of the Electoral Act 2022, all 18 political parties had served the required notices indicating the dates for their conventions, congresses and primaries.
“Given the importance of the exercise to the emergence of candidates for the various elective positions for the 2023 General Elections, it is imperative to remind political parties that they have one month from today to conclude their primaries.
The deadline remains Friday, June 3.”While urging the parties to ensure rancour-free and transparent exercise, the Commission reiterated that the deadline remained firm and fixed.
“Political parties are further reminded that they must submit to the commission the list of candidates who must have emerged from valid primaries.

Under the umbrella of APC North-South PatrioticCoalition (ANSPAC), led by Toyin Rahim, the protesters grounded human and vehicular movements at the party secretariat.

headline: With over N30bn from Sale of Forms, APC Gets Firepower for 2023 Elections
summarized_story:
A rundown on the expected revenue from the electoral process shows APC may generate over N2.3 billion from the sale of presidential forms; N2.8 billion from the sale of governorship forms; and roughly N6.54 billion from the sale of senatorial forms.
The party could make about N10.8 billion from the sale of forms to a minimum of three House of Representatives aspirants from each of the country’s 360 federal constituencies.
So far, 23 presidential aspirants have indicated interest in the presidency under the ruling party and APC is expected to generate N2.3 billion from the sale of presidential forms.
Others are former National Chairman of APC, Adams Oshiohmole; former Governor of Ogun State, Senator Ibikunle Amosun; Minister of Transportation, Rt.

headline: Guterres: UN Committed to Peaceful Nigeria
summarized_story:
•Wants attackers of Global Body’s Building in 2011 ProsecutedDeji Elumoye and Michael Olugbode in AbujaUnited Nations (UN) Secretary-General Antonio Guterres says the intergovernmental organisation remains steadfast in its commitment to a peaceful Nigeria.
Guterres stated this yesterday in Abuja during a two-day visit to the country.
Guterres called for the prosecution of those that attacked the UN House in Abuja on August 26, 2011, stressing that perpetrators of terrorism in Nigeria must be held to account.
The UN secretary-general said the war in Ukraine would make things worse with regard to global food, energy and financial systems.
The president thanked the secretary general for the maiden visit to Nigeria.

headline: Buhari Meets UN Scribe, Guterres, at Aso Villa
summarized_story:
Deji Elumoye in AbujaPresident Muhammadu Buhari Wednesday met with the Secretary General of the United Nations (UN), Antonio Guterres, at the State House, Abuja.
The president received the UN chief and his team at the forecourt of the Presidential Villa at about 3.03pm.
After a brief welcome ceremony, President Buhari led Guterres to his office where they had a meeting before returning to brief the media.
At the briefing, President Buhari stressed the importance of the visit at a time the world’s attention is focused on the Russia-Ukraine war.
In his remark, Guterres said his visit was in solidarity with victims of terrorism.

headline: 2023: Jigawa Gov, Badaru, Joins Presidential Race
summarized_story:
Ibrahim Shuaibu in DutseJigawa State Governor Muhammad Badaru Abubakar has declared interest in contesting the 2023 presidential election on the platform of the All Progressives Congress (APC).
Kila said: “It is true that Governor Badaru has travelled to Abuja to secure nomination form for the 2023 presidential election.”He explained that his principal has the necessary wherewithal to lead the country to the promised land.
THISDAY gathered that on Tuesday evening, the governor informed the party’s stakeholders of his ambition to contest for the presidency.
Governor Badaru informed the gathering that he will seek for the blessing of President Buhari before purchasing the form.
The governor has since left the state capital, Dutse, for Abuja to obtain the form ahead of the presidential primary elections of the party.

headline: EXCLUSIVE: Vice President Osinbajo Gifts 300 Dollars Each To Over 400 APC Delegates In Adamawa, Taraba States
summarized_story:
As the Nigerian naira continues to struggle against the United States dollar, the Vice President, Yemi Osinbajo has stepped up his game of clinching the presidential ticket of the All Progressives Congress (APC) with the distribution of $300 each to about 400 presidential nomination delegates in Adamawa and Taraba states.
The Vice President reportedly switched from doling out money in naira to hard currency in order to stay on top of his game.
SaharaReporters reported on April 22, 2022, that some presidential delegates of the ruling All Progressives Congress in the South-West on Friday went home with N250,000 each after attending a meeting with Vice President Yemi Osinbajo in Ibadan, Oyo State.
“This was what we were given by Osinbajo today,” a delegate had said while showing the money packaged in an envelope.
A visibly elated VP was accompanied to Muna Hotel in Yola, the venue of the meeting by some APC party senators, House of Representatives members and cronies of President Muhammadu Buhari.

headline: 2023: Presidential hopeful sues PDP over 'high cost' of nomination form
summarized_story:
Okey Uzoho, a presidential hopeful, has filed a case against the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) for allegedly denying him the opportunity to contest in the party’s May 28 presidential primary.
Uzoho, a lawyer and member of the PDP, claimed that the high cost of the expression of interest and nomination forms for presidential hopefuls will prevent him from participating in the primary.
The PDP had fixed N40 million for its expression of interest and nomination forms for presidential aspirants.
He added that aside from the form fee, he met all the requirements of the 1999 constitution and extant laws for participation in the presidential primary of the party for the 2023 election.
The plaintiff is seeking N50 million as compensation for the “anxiety, inconvenience, and loss of valuable campaign time” over his inability to participate in the presidential primary.

headline: COVID: WHO says 14.9m deaths linked to pandemic — 148% more than virus toll
summarized_story:
The World Health Organisation (WHO) says the deaths linked to the COVID pandemic between January 2020 and December 2021 was approximately 14.9 million.
The figure is two times more than the reported six million deaths which have been recorded as a result of COVID.
AdvertisementAccording to the WHO, the excess deaths include fatalities associated with COVID directly or indirectly (due to the pandemic’s impact on health systems and society).
The organisation also said most of the excess deaths – 84 percent — are concentrated in south-east Asia, Europe, and the Americas, while about 68 percent of excess deaths are concentrated in just 10 countries globally.
“WHO is committed to working with all countries to strengthen their health information systems to generate better data for better decisions and better outcomes,” he added.

headline: The biggest African tech moves from April
summarized_story:
From MTN’s PSB license approval and Airtel’s super-agent license in Nigeria, to Sun King’s $260 million raise in Kenya, and CAR’s crypto adoption, here are the top 10 biggest tech moves in April.
West Africa comes in second with $90.5 million announced across 18 funding deals.

headline: Customs intercepts 1000 bags of poisonous rice brought from India
summarized_story:

Acting Comptroller, FoU, Zone A, Hussein Ejibunu, during a press conference on Thursday, said that the bags of parboiled rice came into Cotonou from India.
He said the foreign rice were tested by the National Agency for Food Drug Administration and Control (NAFDAC) and confirmed to be poisonous and unsafe for consumption.
“After seizing the smuggled rice, we called NAFDAC to conduct laboratory analysis and it was gathered that the rice named SIMBA which consist of Led substances that is poisonous to the body was produced in India,” he said.

headline: Nigeria Hopeful of Return of 96 Benin Artefacts from Cologne
summarized_story:
Nigeria’s Ambassador to Germany, Mr. Yusuf Tuggar has said the federal government was confident that 96 Benin artefacts looted by the British Colonial masters about 125 years ago, and domiciled in Cologne, Germany would be returned to the country.
Tuggar, gave the assurance at the, ‘I Miss You Exhibition’ at Rautenstrauch-Joest Museum, Cologne attended by the city’s Deputy Mayor, Andreas Wolter, the Director of the museum, Nannete Snoep, the Chairman Edo United, Cologne, Samuel Egharevba and art historian Professor Peju Layiwola.
